title: Introduction to Group Discussions: Mainstreaming OER Practices
segmentation: So I'm going to give you a short introduction to the parallel sessions.

The objective here is just to give you an idea of what the sessions are going to be about, so that you are make your choice which one you'd like to go to and also give you some indications on what sort of work that we would appreciate from the sessions and the format and also my colleague function who is somewhere will be speaking about giving further information so.

And for each of these we have a parallel session.

Just to give you a refreshing refresh just to revive a little bit what the subjects are.

The first workshop is going to be on the capacity of users to access, reuse and share or we are, so it's the capacity to find, retain, modify, share materials under open licenses, user friendly tools to locate, retrieve or we are the next one is on language and cultural issues and this one is on the importance that Ovr is available in diverse languages, particularly those which are less used under resourced.
Or endangered as well as indigenous languages.
Or we are is adapted to cultural contexts.
An it's accepted for sharing and use of notes from different sources.

Thank you for the introduction.
I think we are in the middle of this Congress and the theme of this Congress is from the commitment to action.
I think it's time for us to really define our commitment under the Education 2030 and also to plan the road map for the action.
So for this purpose I would like.
To recap, the Education 2030 under the SDG four, we all understand that the overall goal is to ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning for all.
Actually under this SDG four UNESCO publish document called Inchin Education 2030 again declaration and Framework for action.
Under this one we set up with some targets for the achievement of STD.
And I tried to restructure this targets.
First of all, I tried to group those targets, who that should be under the school, education or institutional education.

For example, the pre primary education will promote that at least we should have two year pre primary education for many many countries is a challenge because we are promoting the universal access to two year pre primary education.
Its request a huge.
Incremental cost or budget and at the same time we are following the universal primary education, but we extended to a secondary education.

You is kind of compulsory secondary education at the same time we are promoting if possible, to provide Tibbetts and to expand access to higher education and alongside this track will promoting the gender equality as a priority and at the same time we're promoting education for sustainable development and.
The development of a global citizenship which too many Member States is very weak and also a weaker concept to many of the you know educators and also the researchers.

So those to me those are the targets that are under school system and then we are promoting the use literacy and also we are promoting if possible to provide all the adults and the workers and even those people who need record reskilling.
With the kind of opportunity for skills development.
This all the targets.

So before we talk about the extras before we divide the commitment, we should really, really have a full picture about the SDA four and all the targets are under this SDA four and our action will be more related to the enablers to achieve the SDG four, including how to create enabling learning environment within the school and beyond the school and the informal education system and also in the.
Non formal and informal learning environment or setting up for this purpose.

I think we are really has a niche position and very important role to play to support this kind of enabling environment of course and we have we already talked a lot about OS potential to empower teachers or teachers capacity to make effective pedagogical use of ovr.
So we need to really provision what's the relationship between teachers and we are.
And of course we also promoting.
And kind of scholarship to especially to promote the high education.
I think I want to give you the big picture under this context.

I tried to summarize and of course of course cutting issue is the inclusion along all the factors we need to think whether this kind of linear opportunity is inclusive for anybody, whether the disabled people or people in the promoter, region or under the pool resource settings.
And we need to think of the relevance of this learning to different culture.
Different country.
Different groups and.
For this purpose and also based on my direct experience of working with more than 20 countries in developing the national, we are policy and strategies.
I tried to summarize what should be the targets of the ER policy and we are actions before we are really want to carry forward this kind of action under the SDG four framework.
The first one is how we should have a kind of inclusive we are to make that we are inclusive for everyone, for including those people with disability.

And we can also the people we call them disadvantaged, group and the Secondly we're talking about how to make we are available and accessible for the indigenous language and also for the culture because we are facing multiple culture here.
And of course we need to think whether Ovr is really a kind of cost efficient modality to deliver or to advance the equity in general and the gender equality in specific in particular and then.
How more the mainstream use of ICT in school system is?
How to use.
We are to promote students knowledge deepening and knowledge creation is relating to the new pedagogical activity.
And how we can use our yard to expand high location?
This is one of the most developed area we can see.
A lot of open universities and traditional University using ovr to expand the access to learning materials and but we are fortified.
We are for general skills.
Development is new area and then the ER for non formal education to me has not been discussed so much during this Congress, even during the daily work.
Of course is the most challenging issues.
How we can use ovr to really promoted the life long and a life wide learning and for this purpose loser the action line I was in.
I have observed that already happening and I hope we will also happen in the better quality and on the larger skill.
First of all, sometimes reaching relating to kind of you know regulatory framework.
Sometimes the country needs to develop some, some low some.
Framework to really talk about the open lessons and to regulate the development of content and also the policy on open license.
What kind of lessens the government want to adopt?
For?

What kind of content and how to make inclusive access through digital device or through traditional library to really to enable the people who live in the remote region and who under full resource the settings that we can really really access the high quality.
Ojars that are already made available by the government and by other stakeholders and how we should deal with the ER repository.
I think nowadays we are not facing the problem.
A shortage of repository.
We're facing a problem of too many repository and not integrated multiple repository existing for teachers for students to choose from.
How we should manage them and then capacity building for teachers and for other users.
In terms of making pedagogical you suffer, we are because Asha risk the HVS study.
We are available but the use of we are is a big issue.

We really need to ensure that they are being used and effectively for this target and one of the issue is how we should incentivize teachers, students and other providers to not only create but also share that we are widely should share.
Where's the incentive?
I think we should think of the incentive mechanism.
And of course, we have been discussing about the business, especially the sustainable business many times, and it will, I think to me, continue to be an issue.
And of course we shouldn't forget that we are research, especially to enhance the evidence base of using.
We are.
What's the impact whether it's really make deliver the promise or it's just fake assumption.
So we need to do the research and if possible, kind of robust research.

And to to make this happen, we need to think of the enablers including the policy, enable another implement implementation strategy in abler, including how we should cost those kind of program and policy where should be defending from from government, from stakeholders, why they should contribute, and how we should have kind of cool sharing, costing or funding mechanism.
And if we are going to, as you know, the keynote speaker mentioned.
If we are going to develop policy and must plan.
How we can align the ER policy and must plan with other existing and overall education sector strategy or policy?
We cannot add more and more and more policy to the government.
It will become another disaster to the government and to the implementers.
We should think of the alignment and the monitoring and evaluation.
Don't need to mention the importance and then public awareness how we should sensitize the implementer.
Implementing agencies within the government, and at the same time.
To sensitize the public, including parents, communities and publishing published sectors to really help them to understand the potential for we are and to join us to take forward ovr endeavors.
And then the partnership.
So we all understand the congresses for partnership.
So I think I should enter the presentation now.
And we will have a session on the supportive policy environment that will take place in room M2.
You're welcome to join back, so we will discuss how we can provide or enable the open technology.
Open lessons, open educational practice and open education provision and how we can create the open content and how we should do for the quality assurance and we will talk about.
So the partners so you know, we divide the stakeholders into government, civil society and the private sector.
And what kind of partnership and collaboration we should, you know?
Making sure that it will happen and also to sync up for the Inter government or International Corporation.
So I want to end the presentation and thank you for attention.
Listen by email.

If in the education sector of units cool looking forward to working with you and thank you very very much for your time.
